title: Software Developer Engineer
body: Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.EA SPORTS is one of the most iconic brands in entertainment with over 25 years of innovation, passion, and connection of millions of players across the globe to their favorite sports, teams, and players. At the heart of EA SPORTS is the FIFA franchise. EA SPORTS FIFA is the world’s #1 best-selling video game with over 200M engaged players across multiple platforms, including console, PC, and mobile.Innovation, passion, and team-work are at the heart of everything we do. With studios in Vancouver, Bucharest, and Cologne; we are looking for the brightest talent so we can continue to create experiences that connect with millions of hearts and minds the world over.The RoleFIFA Ultimate Team C++ Engineers work on the Client side of FIFA Ultimate Team game mode, mainly using C++ technology.As part of the FIFA Ultimate Team you will work on the features that build the most used game mode of the FIFA game using the existing architecture or bring in improvements to the UI Framework and Frostbite add-ons that we are using to build the features. FIFA Ultimate team is an exclusive Online game mode so you will be working side-by-side with the Server team members to be able to implement features like stadium customization, season objectives, FUT club or transfer market.ResponsibilitiesDesign and implement features for FIFA Ultimate team game modeDesign, maintains, implements, tests and debugs code, pipelines and other Ultimate Team related sub-components and packages.Work with Server Engineers, Production and Interface Designers to gather requirements and write technical design specificationsIn the Denied Party Screening group we build automatic mechanisms to detect and prevent prohibited transactions with denied parties. We are looking for Software Development Engineers with strong analytical and problem solving skills, who will participate in full development cycle for a mission critical system that screens customers from the moment they are introduced to Amazon and at every point they interact and transact with Amazon’s various businesses and products. The project is continuously growing and creating opportunities to innovate and deliver.You will collaborate with your team and its leadership to drive key engineering and business decisions that will influence the Amazon transaction compliance. You will contribute to all parts of the software development and deployment lifecycle, including design, implementation, documentation, testing and operations.Successful candidates for this position will have strong software engineering fundamentals (object-oriented design, algorithms and data structures) and a good grasp of distributed systems concepts and design. They must possess strong verbal and written communication skills, be self-driven and deliver high quality results in a fast-paced environment.Basic QualificationsBachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field, or 2+ year relevant work experience;Deep understanding / hands-on experience with object-oriented design and data structures;Deep understanding / hands-on experience with algorithm design, problem solving and complexity analysis;Proficiency in at least one prgramming language such as C, C++ or Java;Excellent command of written and spoken English;Preferred QualificationsKnowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations;Exposure to agile software development methodologies;Have previous experience in gathering business information and transform it in technical requirements;Experience with secure systems and architecting applications that deal with sensitive information;Company - Amazon Dev Ctr (Romania) S.R.LQualificationsObject-oriented programming experience of OO design principles2+ years experience in C++ software developmentExperience in UI technologies (Qt, Unity or Unreal UI frameworks or web front-end development) is very nice to haveExperience in ActionScript or open-minded to learn the basics of itFamiliarity with scripting languages (Python, Lua), C# and SQL is nice to haveAbility to work with existing and unfamiliar codeExperience working within an agile team

title: Software Engineer

title: Software Engineer
body: Minimum qualifications:Software engineering and programming experience in JavaExperience as a site reliability engineerExperience with Unix/Linux operating systemsPreferred qualifications:Experience being part of an on-call rotation and responding to production incidentsExperience with cloud computing platformsKnowledge of the Python programming language and ecosystemKnowledge of the internals of applications and frameworks such as Kafka, Aurora/Mesos, ZooKeeper, Spring, Hibernate, Finagle, Thrift, gRPC, Prometheus, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Grafana, and TerraformAbility to effectively lead small to medium sized projectsAbout The JobFitbit Site Reliability Engineering team ensures that Fitbit's site and backend services are available, healthy, and that customers are having a positive experience. We advocate best practices to measure, manage and enhance site reliability. We encourage others to treat change, operational flexibility and observability as first-class concerns and make informed tradeoffs between functional and operational goals. We are involved in incident and change management. We also act as consultants for engineers when new code and services are getting ready to launch. Our goal is to transform the system such that services have service-level objectives (SLOs) and the appropriate amount of monitoring/alerting so that teams can balance shipping fast with maintaining the stability and reliability of their features and services. You are familiar with Java and its ecosystem in order to contribute to the SRE team commitments when it comes to building, scaling, and operating Java-based applications.Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.ResponsibilitiesCreate and own technical design documentsWrite code in Java and perhaps PythonAct as a product owner for the tools, systems, and/or applications you work onContribute to process improvements that boost productivity and qualityParticipate in the team’s production on-call rotation Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. title: Software Engineer
body: Do you have passion to provide best protection in the most efficient way? Do you have a drive to implement products, tools and services and to deliver innovative solutions in order to provide best antimalware product experience?The Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection team is looking for you. Our team delivers an industry leading engine and platform which provide software protection, malware detection and removal features for Windows powered devices for end user, cloud and enterprise space. Our client products are tightly integrated with state of the art backend services to protect hundreds of millions of customers in real time and disrupt the malware ecosystem at scale.The Microsoft Defender Advanced Protection technologies consist of a wide variety of software encompassing kernel drivers, user mode system services, application and user interface level components. They include virtualization and emulation technologies, behavior detection, pattern matching, file format and network protocol parsers, exploit and intrusion prevention, reverse engineering systems, and much more. We are looking for team members who can help us improving overall performance of our client technology by keeping the protection bar high.ResponsibilitiesThe team needs world class software development talent, and above all, very smart individuals. We are looking for fast learning, highly-motivated, creative or analytical Software Engineers who can work hand in hand with us to evolve the protection capabilities in our products. As a developer in this position you will innovate and join a team of great engineers. You will work closely with Researchers, Program Managers and other Security Engineering disciplines. You will fill a vital role in protecting hundreds of millions of customers in most efficient way. You will help build the next generation of protection features, protecting against malware and other type of attacksQualificationsRequired qualifications:5+ years of experience as a software engineer working on industrial-strength software and a proven track record of having shipped commercially-successful software products & services5+ years of experience in designing data structures, algorithms, highly concurrent programming, analysis of algorithm complexity3+ years of experienceworking in C/C++BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or EngineeringPreferred QualificationsExperience writing commercial desktop application softwareExperience with operating system internals (Windows, Linux and/or MacOS)Proven track record of owning features/scenarios and driving them from conception to completion with minimal guidanceRequirementsThese requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screeningsAbility to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role.Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. title: Software Engineer
body: Title. Software Engineer Job type. Remote. Employment type. Full time, indefinite contract. Job location. Romania Salary range. €2000-€2500 per month Description We’re looking for a Software Engineer who is passionate about software development, implementing high quality customer facing functionality and able to embrace change in a modern/fast-paced environment. Working remotely, you will join my client’s Romania-based Cloud Engineering team. You will be working on a wearable Internet-of-Things product with a powerful web application hosted in Microsoft Azure, as part of an exciting start-up with members across the globe. The organisation is led by energetic start-up veterans with world-class experience delivering successful new technology products.  This is a role ideally suited to a Computer Science graduate plus a year’s professional experience or somebody with a few years of programming experience. The ideal candidate will have good experience in the technologies listed below, but the ability and desire to learn are more important. Native or bilingual English is a must.  A new Software Engineer in this organisation will be supplied all the equipment they need for their role, any training required, and mentorship from the team’s Senior Software Engineers. There will be plenty of development and advancement opportunities as the organisation develops its product using new technologies.  You will be hired as a contractor, working as a permanent and full-time part of the team. The role is nearly entirely remote, although the team expects to meet four times a year, for an all-expenses paid week together, either in Romania or the North of England. The contract payment will be in the range of €2000-2500 per calendar month depending on experience.  To apply for this role, please email a CV to apply@engrecruit.com before 05/11/2021. Feel free to send any questions about the role to this email address as well.  Essential skills: Computer Science (at least five years full time experience, or a degree plus a year of professional experience) Front-end Web Development Native or bilingual English Willingness to learn new technologies  Desirable skills: C# Angular ASP.NET Effective written and verbal communication  Nice to have skills Microsoft Azure Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery Unit/Regression/Automated Testing
